About me

I am currently a Byrne Instructor in Applied Mathematics. My mentor is Prof. Anne Gelb. I am on the job market this year.

I received my Ph.D in Applied Mathematics in 2020 from the Department of Mathematics, UC Davis, advised by Prof. Qinglan Xia. My dissertation topic is From optimal transport to optimal mixing flows and vice versa.

Prior to that, I received my B.S in Mathematics and Applied Mathematics in 2014 from Zhejiang University and finished my undergraduate thesis supervised by Prof. Zhi (George) Lin.

Here is my complete CV. (Last Update: Oct, 2022)
